cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW across Cuba, then turning northwest and intensifying over the central/north-west Gulf of Mexico toward the upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coastline (near the TX/LA border)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire upper Texas and Louisiana coastline, including Galveston Bay and Texas City vicinity
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–58+ mph) are possible with a 39% cumulative chance; brief gusts to near hurricane force cannot be ruled out if the track shifts westward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–5 ft in and around Galveston Bay, including Texas City dike and refinery docks, especially with onshore flow ahead of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible with locally higher amounts if rain bands pivot across Galveston Bay region, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes within outer rain bands and short-fused channel/harbor restrictions due to elevated seas and tides.
